SENT.plain: Moyamoya is an intriguing and controversial syndrome
This patient study serves to align the pathophysiology of intracranial hemorrhage in moyamoya with the cerebral vascular disease seen with hypertension, or aging

The historical evidence linking lipohyalinosis and microaneurysms to cerebral hemorrhage is reviewed, the pathogenesis of this angiopathy is discussed, and explanations considered for its association with the vascular pattern of moyamoya
We propose that hemodynamics, genetics or both are among the primary operant etiologic factors
